EXPERIMENT.Definition: a test done in order to learn something or to discover if something works or is true

TIP.Definition: a useful piece of information, especially about how to do something

DAILY.Definition: happening on or relating to every day

WEEKLY.Definition: happening once a week or every week

CLOSE.Definition: connected or involved in strong relationship with someone

SIMILAR.Definition: looking or being almost the same, although not exactly

FORMALITIES.Definition: something that has to be done but has no real importance

JOURNEY.Definition: a set of experiences that someone has over a period of time

IMMERSING.Definition: to become completely involved in something

FOREIGN.Definition: belonging or connected to a country that is not your own

BULLSHIT.Definition: complete nonsense or something that is not true

PHILOSOPHY.Definition: the use of reason in understanding such things as the nature of the real world and existence, the use and limits of knowledge, and the principles of moral judgment

OVERTHINK.Definition: to think about something too much, in a way that is not useful

EFFECTIVE.Definition: successful or achieving the results that you want

LINGUIST.Definition: someone who studies foreign languages or can speak them very well, or someone who teaches or studies linguistics

INTENT.Definition: a planned intention; something that they want or intend to do; aim

IMITATE.Definition: to behave in a similar way to someone or something else, or to copy the speech or behaviour, etc. of someone

CONTEXT.Definition: the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it

LOGICAL.Definition: reasonable and based on good judgment

STRATEGY.Definition: a detailed plan for achieving success

METHODOLOGY.Definition: a system of ways of doing, teaching, or studying something

BENEFIT.Definition: an advantage or profit gained from something

INFER.Definition: form an opinion or guess that something is true because of the information that you have

TONE.Definition: a quality in the voice that expresses the speaker's feelings or thoughts, often towards the person being spoken to

SOAKING.Definition: absorbing, understanding and remembering information well

EXPRESS YOURSELF.Definition: communicate what you think or feel, by speaking or writing, or in some other way

COURSES.Definition: a set of classes or a plan of study on a particular subject, usually leading to an exam or qualification

OVERCOMPLICATE.Definition: to make something more difficult than it already is

SPECIALTY.Definition: a subject that someone knows a lot about

PRE-INTERMEDIATE.Definition: having a general idea of what is being said but have some difficulties

INTERMEDIATE.Definition: having reached a fairly good level of skill or knowledge

ADVANCED.Definition: those who can understand almost everything including idiomatic expressions and can compose complex texts and can use the language for professional or social usage

TRANSLATE.Definition: to change words into a different language

NECESSARY.Definition: needed in order to achieve a particular result

REALITY.Definition: the state of things as they are, rather than as they are imagined to be

CHALLENGE.Definition: (the situation of being faced with) something that needs great mental or physical effort in order to be done successfully and therefore tests a person's ability

COMPREHENSION.Definition: the ability to understand completely and be familiar with a situation, facts, etc.

TRANSMISSION.Definition: the process of broadcasting or sending out something on the internet

WHOO!.Definition: an expression used to express sudden excitement or relief

IMMA.Definition: informal way of saying “I’m gonna” or “I am going to”
